attributes.action: Push for School Science Technicians to get a better rate of pay
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Initiatives in the pipeline to increase the number of pupils taking separate Sciences will have a considerable knock on effect on the workload of Technicians.  Technicians are already recognised by professional bodies as the "expert" in the Science Department on practical Science issues, often training teachers in practical techniques and advising on safety, yet we earn less than £10 per hour.  This state of affairs needs to remedied quickly if Science Education is to be at the forefront of government policy.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Push for School Science Technicians to get a better rate of pay."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
